DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MAEDA, E. E.;Maeda, Eduardo Eiji;Maeda, Eduardo E.;MAEDA, E. E;MAEDA, E.;MAEDA, EDUARDO;Maeda, Eduardo Eijji

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Engenheiro Agrcola e Ambiental formado pela Universidade Federal de Viosa. Cursou parte de sua graduao na Iowa State University, EUA, em 2005. Tem Mestrado em Sensoriamento Remoto pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE) e Doutorado pela University of Helsinki, Finlndia. Realizou cursos complementares na Alemanha, Dinamarca e ustria. Possui experincia em sensoriamento remoto, modelagem , anlise de sistemas ambientais e redes neurais artificiais. Atua em temas relacionados s mudanas do uso da terra, hidrologia e mudanas climticas. Entre 2011-2012 trabalhou para a Comisso Europeia em pesquisas cientficas relacionadas ao desenvolvimento de mtodos baseados em dados de satlite para monitoramento dos recursos hdricos na Amrica Latina e Africa. Atualmente atua como pesquisador e coordenador de projetos na Universidade de Helsinki.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering from Iowa State University (2005), graduate at Engenharia Agrcola e Ambiental from Universidade Federal de Viosa (2005) and master's at Geosciences from Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (2008). Has experience in Agricultural Engineering, focusing on Agricultural Engineering, acting on the following subjects: agricultura de preciso, classificao de madeira, anlise discriminante, georreferenciamento and viso artificial.

SERVICO-TECNICO-ESPECIALIZADO.NOME-ORGAO: Centro de Preparao de Oficiais da Reserva

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Coordenao Geral de Observao da Terra

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Impacto e sustentabilidade ambiental da substituio do bioma Cerrados por atividades agropecurias no Brasil Central
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O bioma do Cerrado cobre aproximadamente 45% da Amrica do Sul e grande parte do Brasil Central. No Brasil, as atividades agropecurias foram responsveis pelo desflorestamento de aproximadamente 40% deste importante bioma florestal. Este projeto tem como objetivo realizar uma avaliao aprofundada dos impactos destas mudanas e de que forma os novos tipos de explorao podero se sustentar a curto, a mdio e a longo prazos. Para tanto, sero utilizados modelos matemticos, dados de sensoriamento remoto, tcnicas de geoprocessamento e de dados multifontes, de forma a quantificar a degradao causada em funo dos desflorestamentos e apontar as reas crticas do ponto de vista de preservao e manejo dos solos e dos recursos naturais.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MAEDA, E. E.;Maeda, Eduardo Eiji;Maeda, Eduardo E.;MAEDA, E. E;MAEDA, E.;MAEDA, EDUARDO;Maeda, Eduardo Eijji

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Influncia da Mudana do Uso e Cobertura da Terra no Escoamento Superficial e Produo de Sedimentos na Regio da Bacia do Alto Rio Xingu
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Uso de dados de Sensoriamento Remoto, modelos hidrolgicos e modelos de eroso, para availar os impactos do desflorestamento da Floresta Amaznica no ciclo hidrolgico e produo de sedimentos. O estudo de caso est sendo realizado na Bacia do Alto Rio Xingu.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Climate Change Impacts on Ecosystem Services and Food Security in Eastern Africa (CHIESA)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective of the Climate Change Impacts on Ecosystem Services and Food Security in Eastern Africa (CHIESA) project is to increase the knowledge on the impact of climate change on ecosystem services in the Eastern Afromontane Biodiversity Hotspot (EABH) through research, training and dissemination. It will build the capacity of research communities, extension officers and decision-makers in environmental research in agriculture, hydrology, ecology and geoinformatics. The project also develops, disseminates and builds capacity for adaptation to climate change in eastern Africa. The project consortium consists of icipe, a regional research institute which is the project implementing agency, and four universities, two in Europe and two in Africa. As lead partners the universities, together with icipe, coordinate the 8 work packages and the participation of 22 stakeholder institutions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Climate Change Impacts on Ecosystem Services and Food Security in Eastern Africa (CHIESA)

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MAEDA, E. E.;Maeda, Eduardo Eiji;Maeda, Eduardo E.;MAEDA, E. E;MAEDA, E.;MAEDA, EDUARDO;Maeda, Eduardo Eijji

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Climate extremes in the Amazon rainforest: unveiling the impacts of droughts on environmental processes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Despite its vast geographical dimensions, the Amazon ecosystem is particularly vulnerable to environmental changes. For examples, changes in average precipitation can cause massive biodiversity loss and have serious consequences for local communities. In this context, climate change poses a big challenge for science. Currently, it is still unclear how the Amazon rainforest behaves under water stress conditions and to which extent it can adapt to climate variability. Solving these remaining questions is crucial for protecting the Amazon forest biodiversity and reducing vulnerability to climate change. This project will aim to identify the factors driving the capacity of the forest to resist to droughts. To achieve this objective, the project will use the most advanced techniques and satellite sensors currently available for the scientific community.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MAEDA, E. E.;Maeda, Eduardo Eiji;Maeda, Eduardo E.;MAEDA, E. E;MAEDA, E.;MAEDA, EDUARDO;Maeda, Eduardo Eijji

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Agricultural expansion and climate change in the Taita Hills, Kenya: an integrated assessment of potential environmental impacts
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Taita Hills are the northernmost part of the Eastern Arc Mountains of Kenya and Tanzania, which is one of the world?s most important regions for biological conservation. The indigenous cloud forests in this area have suffered substantial degradation for several centuries due to agricultural expansion. Currently, only 1% of the original forested area remains preserved in the Taita Hills, Kenya. Furthermore, climate change imposes imminent treat for local economy and environmental sustainability. In such circumstances, elaborating public policies that can effectively conciliate socioeconomic growth and natural resources conservation is an enormous challenge. The objective of this project is to address specific elements of each of this challenges. Namely, this study will provide methodological improvements necessary for obtaining basic information from the agricultural activities in the Taita Hills, Kenya. Furthermore, the study will carry out interdisciplinary studies, which integrate different technologies and modelling techniques aiming to understand specific environmental aspects and delineate future environmental scenarios for Taita Hills.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MAEDA, E. E.;Maeda, Eduardo Eiji;Maeda, Eduardo E.;MAEDA, E. E;MAEDA, E.;MAEDA, EDUARDO;Maeda, Eduardo Eijji

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: EUROCLIMA is a cooperation program between the European Union and Latin America with a special focus in knowledge sharing on topics related to socio-environmental problems associated with climate change. The specific objective of the project is to improve knowledge of Latin American decision-makers and the scientific community on problems and consequences of climate change, particularly in view of integrating these issues into sustainable development strategies.
